text.p: These are the leading stories in the Beirut press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-The new cabinet comprises seven new ministers, four former ministers, and 19 from the outgoing cabinet.
-Inflation stood at 4.2 percent and econnomic growth at five percent by the end of September 1996.
-Lebanon joins an electricity network linking Syria, Jordan, Iraq, Eygpt, and Turkey.
-The Bank of Lebanon issued certificates of deposit to commercial banks worth 15 billion Lebanese pounds.
-The ministry of interior will hand over to the constitutional court all documents related to the parliamentary elections.
The council will soon begin studying 19 appeals against parliamentary results lodged by defeated candidates.
-The total sum of custom revenue in october is 163 billion Lebanese pounds.
-Former Christian militia leader Samir Geagea will face today the court on charges of attempted killing of current Minister of Interior Michel Murr back in 1991.
